description: Spanish are a civilization that excels in gunpowder units, monk units, and cavalry.
dark_age: Start with 3 villagers, a scout, and a unique building - the Missionary.
Build 2 houses and a lumber camp near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Build a mining camp near gold and stone mines to gather resources for later ages.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 22-23 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 1000-1200 food, 100-150 wood, and 100-150 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 3-4 to wood, and 2-3 to gold.
feudal_age: Build a market and blacksmith to trade and upgrade units.
Build a monastery and train monks to convert enemy units.
Build a stable and start producing scouts and knights.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 2000-2500 food, 600-800 wood, 500-600 gold, and 400-500 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 15-18 villagers to food, 7-8 to wood, 5-6 to gold, and 6-7 to stone.
castle_age: Build a castle to produce powerful unique units and defend your base.
Build a second stable and produce more knights.
Build a siege workshop and start producing siege units to take down buildings and enemy units.
Research gunpowder technologies at the castle.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 35-36 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2000-2500 wood, 1500-2000 gold, and 1000-1500 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 30-35 villagers to food, 12-15 to wood, 10-12 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Produce gunpowder units such as hand cannoneers and bombard cannons to destroy enemy units and buildings.
Use monks to convert powerful enemy units such as elephants and siege units.
Have around 5000-6000 food, 3000-4000 wood, and 4000-5000 gold in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 50-60 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 20-25 to stone.
